description:
Desemzia incerta is a species of fungus belonging to the phylum Ascomycota. It is a member of the order Hypocreales and the family Bionectriaceae. Desemzia incerta is a saprobic fungus, meaning it derives its nutrients from decaying organic matter in the environment.

This fungus is characterized by its small, delicate, and often inconspicuous fruiting bodies, which are typically less than 1 millimeter in diameter. The fruiting bodies are typically white or pale in color and may have a velvety or powdery appearance. The fungus reproduces through the production of spores, which are typically dispersed by wind or water.

Desemzia incerta is widely distributed and can be found in various habitats, including decaying wood, leaf litter, and soil. It plays a role in the decomposition of organic matter, contributing to the cycling of nutrients in the ecosystem.

While Desemzia incerta is not considered a major pathogen, it may be of interest to researchers studying fungal diversity and the role of saprobic fungi in the environment.
